page.title: 05River Kennet
page.content: On Tuesday the eleventh of June we went down to the{River Kennet.}We went through some woodland which the villagers call Fairyland, because it is so pretty. We went this way because it is a good short cut. When we got to the River my legs nearly collapsed on me with all that walking. We met{Mr. Woolnough}there. He is the river-keeper.He has had that job for twelve years.He started to show us round. First of all he showed us the place where the old River Kennet used to run. It is a small stream now, but they know it is the route of the old river, because it runs past the site of a Roman villa and it would have served them for their water source. Then we wewnt to see the new River Kennet.The river gets its name from the spring which is its source. This spring rises in the village of West
